results.title: People are different
results.brief_description: Made during one term’s evening classes at a London County Council institute. It shows how differently, in learning to paint, people approach the same subject; how differently they handle materials; and how, having gained confidence in themselves, they are able to work effectively on group painting.

results.title: People and power
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Barrie Howells, John Kemeny, Peter Pearson and Bonnie Sherr Klein
results.brief_description: This film examines Saul Alinsky’s method of organising communities into effective action units based on participatory democracy. Conflict and controversy are an integral part of Alinsky’s approach. Alinsky talks about his philosophy and the dynamics of organisation.

results.title: People along the Mississippi
results.brief_description: The adventures of a toy boat, released at the source of the Mississippi River are used to show the work of the people living along the course of the river and the heritages that these people have brought to America from their former homeland. A French-Canadian boy launches the boat, marked with his name and address. From along the river he receives letters telling of the adventures of this boat: from a Chippewa boy, from Swedish-American towboat captain; from a boy descended from early German migrants, from a girl who is a descended from the pioneers who came west, from a Negro and white boy on the cotton land of the South and from a girl living on the coast of the Gulf of Mexico.

results.title: People + leisure = [People plus leisure equals]
results.creator_credit: British Petroleum, Pilot Films and John Taylor
results.brief_description: With industrialisation in Britain, more people have more time to spend on leisure activities. Made in Co-operation with The Countryside in 1970 Movement, this film examines the growing pressures that increased opportunities for leisure activities bring, particularly among people living in cities. Describes the problems that result from too many people attempting to utilise the inadequate facilities and the impact these pressures put on the countryside generally. Discusses the need for proper planning of future recreational facilities.

results.title: People's palace
results.brief_description: A tour of Hampton Court Palace, which has been open to the public for over a century. Visitors are seen relaxing in this pleasant and historic setting, buying grapes from the ancient Great Vine, watching “real tennis” on the original court and viewing a 400-year old astronomical clock. We see something of the events associated with the Guard Room, the Haunted Gallery, the Chapel Royal and the Great Hall.

results.title: People's march for jobs
results.brief_description: This film is about the people’s march for jobs held in May 1981 from Liverpool to London. The march was a response to the wastage of unemployment in Britain.

results.title: People's holiday
results.brief_description: Danish law provides that every worker in Demark is entitled to annual holidays in summer. Trades Unions and Workers Cooperatives have established Folk Ferie, an organization which arranges holidays and maintains youth hostels and beach holiday towns. Other activities include the provision of farm holidays for city industrial workers and the arrangement of international holidays.

results.title: People's dictator
results.brief_description: This is a portrait of Chinese politician Deng Xiao Ping, a man who holds no official office in China, but runs the country as a virtual dictator. He has been credited as beign the one man who brought China from the brink of starvation to become one of the leading developing nations of the world. His policy of socialism is viewed by many in the West as being a form of Capitalism, but he will be remembered most by his people as the one dictator in 5,000 years of Chinese history who was determined to suppress a non-violent protest with extreme force - Tienamen Square.

results.title: Pentuphouse
results.brief_description: An aging jazz singer (played with poignant resolve by Gillian Jones) must contend with her highly strung, drug using boyfriend. Director Cate Shortland traces with assured confidence the complex and delicate nuances of aging and compromise within a self destructive relationship.
results.description: An aging jazz singer (played with poignant resolve by Gillian Jones) must contend with her highly strung, drug using boyfriend. results.title: Pentuphouse
results.creator_credit: Red Carpet Productions, Australian Film Commission, Anthony Anderson and Cate Shortland
results.brief_description: Della is an ageing jazz singer who is in a destructive relationship with petty crim and drug user, Dale. This haunting and confident short film examines the betrayals and compromises of love and age. The cinematography and script are first rate and the performances by Gillian Jones and Aaron Blabey outstanding. Cast also includes Stephen Curry.
